summary.span: 命名空間可讓您存取對等網路功能。

span.span: The namespace provides access to peer networking functionality.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 對等電腦如何互相探索及解析識別項複雜的原因是暫時性的連線能力和缺少位址記錄，例如網域名稱系統 (DNS) 的存取權。How peers discover each other and resolve identifiers is complicated by transient connectivity and the lack of access to address records such as the Domain Name System (DNS). Windows 對等基礎結構會解決此問題，使用名稱解析和對等探索配置稱為 PNRP。The Windows Peer-to-Peer Infrastructure solves this problem with a name resolution and peer discovery scheme called PNRP. 對等名稱解析通訊協定 (PNRP) 提供對等網路的名稱解析機制。Peer Name Resolution Protocol (PNRP) provides a name resolution mechanism for peer-to-peer networks. PNRP 設計來將名稱解析網路完全點對點的方式。PNRP is designed to resolve a name to a network in a completely peer-to-peer manner. 提供基本的 PNRP 功能命名空間類別。Basic PNRP functionality is provided in the namespace classes. 它們提供的功能，以建立對等，並註冊在的對等。They provide the ability to create a peer and register it in a of peers. 它們也會提供能夠解析到其網路端點、 TCP 連接埠、 雲端或其他地址識別項。They also provide the ability to resolve a to its network endpoint, TCP port, cloud, or other address identifier(s). 提供的對等網路功能的進階的功能命名空間。Advanced functionality for peer-to-peer networking is provided in the namespace. 在 Windows Vista 中，PNRP 會隨附在要求時啟動的應用程式的服務。In Windows Vista, PNRP ships as a service that is started on demand by applications. 此外，還有 PNRP 電腦註冊服務可以由應用程式或使用者手動啟動，如果他們想要發佈的遠端連接和通訊的電腦名稱。In addition, there is a PNRP machine registration service that can be manually enabled by applications or users if they want to publish machine names for remote connections and communications. PNRP 1 版已包含在 Windows XP Service Pack 2 (SP2)、 Windows XP Professional x64 Edition 和 Windows XP Service Pack 1 (SP1) 和 Advanced Networking Pack for Windows XP。PNRP version 1 was included in Windows XP Service Pack 2 (SP2), Windows XP Professional x64 Edition, and Windows XP with Service Pack 1 (SP1) and the Advanced Networking Pack for Windows XP. 此外，還有 PNRP 機器註冊服務可以由應用程式/使用者以手動方式啟用，如果想要發佈的遠端連線與通訊的電腦名稱。In addition, there is a PNRP machine registration service which can be manually enabled by applications/users if there is interest in publishing machine names for remote connection and communication.
